refnamediv.refpurpose: sets the affected rows counter in the current context or in the context of the caller

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The function set_row_count () is used to set the affected rows counter in the current context or in the context of the caller. Therefore it can be used to set the affected rows counter (returned by row_count()) in places where an instead of trigger is used. If result of decrement of the affected rows counter is an negative integer it will be set to zero.

refsect2.title: increment
refsect2.para: An integer to be added to the affected rors counter, can be negative also

refsect2.title: what
refsect2.para: The what have to be 0 or 1, 0 is the default. 0 - for update in current context the counter, 1 - to update the counter in context of the caller.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: The function returns new value of the affected rows , or -1 if action is not applicable.

example.para: The following SQL script will make two instead of triggers on atable "hid" and inside them will are called set_row_count to set the rows inserted or updated in the second table. Also there are two procedures which are used to demonstrate the return value of row_count.
